hypothesis_content.title: Regulatory Momentum Gap Fill
hypothesis_content.statement: Positive regulatory news headlines (e.g., 'Crypto Market Structure Bill Gains Momentum') that generate a +3% to +6% BTC price gap up at the daily open will be partially filled (-50% to -70% of the gap) within the same trading day, as momentum chasers are met with sell-side liquidity from pre-news holders.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In a NEUTRAL regime, strong positive news often triggers a knee-jerk rally that lacks the sustained buying to hold the gap. Sellers use the liquidity event to exit. The specific +3% to +6% range is large enough to attract attention but not large enough to signal a definitive regime change.
entry_conditions: Major positive regulatory headline occurs in pre-market/news cycle
BTC daily open gaps up +3% to +6% from previous day's close
Pre-gap 14-day ATR is below its 30-day average (low prior volatility)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price fills 60% of the gap (i.e., retraces 60% of the gap-up move)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price extends beyond the opening gap, trading >0.5% above the open
exit_conditions.time_exit: Close of the daily candle in which the gap occurred

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: In NEUTRAL regimes, +3% to +6% regulatory gap-ups are fully sustained (less than 40% fill) by the daily close in more than 40% of instances over a 15-sample backtest.
